heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: There are no active storms in the area.  The previous storm started on 13 October 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (186°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.6°C), outside temperature (down 2.0°C), and inside temperature (down 1.6°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (down 159 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 2.9°C), cloud levels (up 330 m), outside temperature (up 1.5°C), and inside temperature (up 2.7°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 158.7m higher than yesterday, 54.4m lower than the past week, 329.7m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 926m to 1357m and averaged 1243.8m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; on the cooler side. Outside; cold spells are likely. Also, dry and less humid conditions and calm and still conditions are expected. A few light raindrops may fall, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and it’s dim outside. High pressure will dominate, leading to stable weather.

washing.phrase: It is nighttime; if you have washing out then bring it in as it will probably get damper overnight.
